column4: Can I use fsck to check all my hard drives?  If so what is the command?
are all of them ext-something?
what do you mean by ext-something
if they are all ext2, ext3 or ext4
I mounted them all to a file named storage.  So I guess if I fsck this folder it will scan all of them huh
fsck doesn't work this way
darn
so do i need to target them with the name specified in /dev
do this: type echo /dev/[hs]d[abcd][0-9]
no, to Guest25477 - this will list all the drives
thanks that is a neat little command
When you type this at a terminal, echo /dev/[hs]d[abcd][0-9] all your partitions will be listed. One of them will be the swap
so what does the fsck command look like with all my HD listed?
it should be fsck /dev/partition
thank you for your help
you need to repeat the command for all your partitions
yeah I read that, so i just need to man up and come back after a couple minutes for each one
i don't remember, but you may need to use sudo
sudo fsck /dev/partition
yes thank you.
take care and thanks for the help again
